definition: to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: My muscles were sore because I had exercised too much.
sentences.chinese: 我因锻炼过度而肌肉发痛。

sentences.english: Then his chest began to hurt .
sentences.chinese: 然后他的胸部开始发痛。

sentences.english: He rubbed his aching legs with liniment.
sentences.chinese: 他用软膏揉擦发痛的双腿。

sentences.english: My throat huts . Id better gargle.
He bent over and rubbed his sore ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他弯下腰去揉搓发痛的脚踝。

sentences.english: This rough shirt prickles my skin.
sentences.chinese: 这件粗布衬衫刺得我皮肤发痛。

sentences.english: That night, I cried until my chest ached .
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我哭了很久，哭到胸口发痛。

sentences.english: I've been having pains in my chest recently.
sentences.chinese: 近来我的胸口一贯发痛。

sentences.english: Her brain and her heart ached.
sentences.chinese: 她的脑子和她的心都在发痛。

sentences.english: My eyes are sore from reading too much.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛由于看书多而发痛。

sentences.english: The universal stare made the eyes ache.
sentences.chinese: 这种普遍的耀眼的色彩令人眼睛发痛。

sentences.english: His ears and fingers stung with cold.
sentences.chinese: 他的耳朵和手指冻得发痛。

definition: to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
restless with anxiety/unbearably hot and anxious
